name: SONY INZONE KBD-H75 Review
pros: Good build quality with an aluminum (top) case
cons: HE functionality isn’t as expansive as it is on some rival boards
High price

name: Razer Huntsman V3 Pro TKL 8KHz Review
pros: Comes with multifunctional controls that are actually useful
cons: Expensive
Wrist rest isn’t great quality
Razer has no web drivers available yet, which is kind of becoming the norm

name: Corsair Vanguard Pro 96 Review
pros: Beautiful LCD screen displays keyboard info and can display custom gifs or images
Virtual Stream Deck integration is a powerful tool for keyboards
Good gaming performances thanks to the HE switches
Side buttons are perfectly integrated into the design
cons: USB port on the bottom is located in a very strange position
Wrist rest feels uncomfortable to use
Case feels a bit less premium than it should at this price point

name: Pulsar eS HE 70 Review
pros: Great typing sound and typing experience
cons: Screen section feels underutilized
Pretty expensive
Raesha magnetic switches don’t allow for much switch customization

name: Corsair K70 Pro TKL Review
pros: Comes with a very decent included wrist rest
cons: Only the main ‘60%’ cluster of keys are HE and hotswappable, others are not
Software is bloaty and clunky

name: Ducky One X Review
pros: Inductive switches feel and sound nice
cons: Functionality of the inductive switches is subpar compared to top HE keyboards
Coil whine sound when RGB lighting is on
No profiles, which makes switching between productivity and gaming settings a pain
Web-based software is buggy and feels incomplete
Battery life (~12 hours with RGB on) isn’t anything to write home about

name: NZXT Function Elite MiniTKL Review
pros: Top case section looks and feels premium
Magnetic switches with rapid trigger and other gaming-centric features
cons: Switches are a bit less sensitive than on some competitors
Plastic bottom plate looks out of place on the white version

name: Wooting 80HE Review
pros: Wootility is still amazing and is constantly being updated
Tons of customization options, both for performance as well as aesthetics
Smooth switches straight out of the box
cons: Case feels a bit less premium than it should at this price
Fewer modding options compared to the 60HE

name: NZXT Function 2 MiniTKL Review
cons: Top plate scratches very easily
Limited customization options for the switches’ behavior
Buttons on the left side are awkwardly placed

name: Razer Huntsman V3 Pro TKL Review
cons: Expensive
Typing sound is loud and not pleasing
Wrist rest is of lower quality than on older Razer keyboards

name: Meletrix BOOG75 Review
pros: Best typing feel and sound I’ve ever had on a gaming keyboard
Configuration is done via a browser window; this is extremely user-friendly
cons: Design won’t suit everyone, and there are no ‘bland’ replacements for the novelty keycaps
Gaming performance isn’t as good on some competitor HE boards (but still miles better than regular mechanical boards)
More expensive than other HE boards out there

name: Lamzu Atlantis Pro Keyboard Review
pros: Backplate design is a great extra
Switches and stabilizers feel nice to use
Hall Effect switches are great for gaming
cons: Rubber keycaps are more difficult to keep clean and looking pristine
Software can be clunky and feels unfinished at times
Not all custom cables fit on this keyboard

name: Wooting 60HE Review
pros: Very precise and responsive customizable switches
Customization can be done in browser and is incredibly easy to use
Made to be modded, so easy to customize to your liking
cons: Typing sound out of the box isn’t the best, but this is a nitpicky complaint

name: Fnatic STREAK80 LP Review
cons: Not very customizable
Lack of analog switch compatibility hurts its gaming performance somewhat
Spacebar stabilizer sometimes rattles (depending on where you’re pressing it)

name: ProjectD Tinker 65 Review
pros: Acoustic foams included in the case
cons: Plastic case feels a little cheap
No real way to completely open up the board, which is strange for a keyboard called ‘Tinker’
Gasket mount isn’t very noticeable when typing

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Blue, Cherry MX Brown, Cherry MX Red, None (Barebones)

name: Logitech G Pro X TKL Review
pros: Comes with an amazing carrying case
cons: Stabilizers are a little rattly (especially the spacebar)
Expensive
No hotswap functionality
Not having switches where the actuation point etc. can be customized is a miss in a board aimed at competitive gamers
Volume wheel feels flimsy and can’t be programmed

specs.Switches: GX Brown Tactile, GX Red Linear, GX Blue Clicky

name: Ducky ProjectD 65 Outlaw Review
pros: ‘Build your own keyboard from scratch’ idea is interesting and fun
Comes with a lot of extras that let you finetune your experience
Comes with robust and luxurious carrying case
Building your own keyboard from scratch entirely feels very rewarding
Comes with all the necessary tools
cons: Not for completely inexperienced people
No explanation in the manual on what different materials do for the sound/feel
Comes without switches or keycaps so the final price makes it an expensive product
Some screws got stripped after disassembling the board once
No hall effect switch functionality, making it less ideal as a gaming keyboard

name: Ducky One 3 SF Aura Review
pros: Transparent case and keycaps make for an impressive lightshow
cons: Some optional software would be nice to have for people who want to configure in-depth lighting profiles and macros

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Black, Cherry MX Brown, Cherry MX Blue, Cherry MX Red, Cherry MX Silent

name: SteelSeries Apex Pro Mini Review
pros: OmniPoint 2.0 switches feel very smooth and pleasant to use
cons: Can’t save lighting profiles to the onboard memory
High price

name: Corsair K100 Air Wireless Review
pros: Tons of customization options on the software side
cons: Stabilizers are rattly and distracting
Keycaps aren’t great
Edges of the aluminum case feel sharp/unpleasant
Expensive

name: Corsair K70 Pro Mini Wireless Review
pros: Possibility to use 8000Hz polling rate (wired mode only)
Receiver storage on the keyboard itself
cons: Stabilizers are rather rattly
Slight case ping
Extra keycaps are of noticeably lower quality than the standard ones

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Blue, Cherry MX Brown, Cherry MX Red, Cherry MX Speed

name: Xtrfy K5 RGB Compact Review
pros: Customizable hardware (top plate, switches, keycaps) allows user to make the board their own
cons: Included case foam is too thin
Pre-lubed stabilizers are overlubed
Lots of good ideas that are poorly executed
Keycaps feel subpar

name: Corsair K70 RGB Pro Review
pros: Lots of extra buttons + a volume rocker
cons: Expensive
Case sounds hollow
Stabilizers are rattly
Makes a high pitched sound at higher brightness levels

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Red, Cherry MX Brown, Cherry MX Blue, Cherry MX Speed, Cherry MX Silent

name: Glorious GMMK 2 Review
pros: Extremely customizable, with tons of in-stock Glorious accessories (switches, keycaps, cables, …) to choose from
Side glow LED strip is a nice touch
cons: Glorious’ software feels cheap
ABS keycaps instead of PBT
Opening up the keyboard is a hassle (which is a shame with such a customization-focused board)
Glorious Fox Linear switches cannot be bought separately and can only be bought as part of a prebuilt GMMK 2

name: Ducky One 3 Mini Review
pros: Easy to mod and open up
cons: No software for people who want to configure in-depth lighting profiles or macros
Key registering/latency issues on certain firmware versions

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Black, Cherry MX Brown, Cherry MX Blue, Cherry MX Red, Cherry MX Silver, Cherry MX Clear, Cherry MX Silent Red

name: Fnatic STREAK65 LP Review
pros: Switches feel nice and smooth and provide a great typing experience
Coiled cable that it comes with is a nice extra touch
cons: Low profile design isn’t for everyone and makes it less customizable than regular keyboards

name: Glorious GMMK Pro Review
pros: Made for customization, with a ton of options to consider
Very premium-feeling and looking aluminum frame
RGB strip on the side adds a stylish extra effect
cons: Gasket mounting system adds very little to the overall experience
Software is unpolished and seems unfinished

name: Logitech G915 TKL Review
pros: Included media keys and volume rocker
Multi-device connectivity thanks to BT and USB connection options
cons: Expensive
Keycaps aren’t the best

specs.Switches: GL Clicky, GL Tactile, GL Linear

name: Ducky Mecha SF Review
cons: Would’ve been nice to see a hotswappable PCB
Cable isn’t as high quality as the rest of the board

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Brown, Cherry MX Black, Cherry MX Blue, Cherry MX Red, Cherry MX Silver, Cherry MX Silent Red

name: Corsair K70 RGB TKL Review
pros: Detachable cable makes it a lot more portable
Nice marriage between portability and features such as media buttons and a volume rocker
cons: Loud
Rattly stabilizers

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Speed, Cherry MX Red

name: HyperX Alloy Origins 60 Review
cons: Noisy stabilizers
Typing sound is subpar

name: Corsair K65 RGB Mini Review
cons: Feels and sounds a little hollow

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Red, Cherry MX Speed, Cherry MX Brown, Cherry MX Blue, Cherry MX Silent

name: Ducky Year of the Rat Review
pros: Interesting packaging with lots of extras
cons: As much about the art as it is about the performance – if you’re only after performance you could just buy a regular Ducky

name: Corsair K60 RGB Pro Review
cons: Viola switches don’t feel very good
Keycaps feel cheap and underwhelming
Typing experience isn’t great: the board is loud and rattly

name: Fnatic STREAK65 Review
cons: Feet are uneven in thickness
ABS keycaps are a letdown

name: HyperX Alloy Origins Core Review
cons: Keycaps are subpar

name: Corsair K100 RGB Review
pros: Lots of extra dials and features for the full ‘battlestation’ experience
Fast OPX switches are good for gaming
cons: Expensive
Not very portable
Macro keys might take some getting used to for some

name: Fnatic miniSTREAK Review
cons: Subpar keycaps

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Brown, Cherry MX Red, Cherry MX Silent, Cherry MX Blue

name: Logitech G Pro X Mechanical Keyboard Review
pros: Hot-swappable PCB means changing switches is very easy
cons: Keycaps don’t feel very premium
Non-standard bottom row means that switching out keycaps can be a hassle

specs.Switches: GX Blue Clicky, GX Brown Tactile, GX Red Linear

name: SteelSeries Apex Pro TKL Review
pros: Customizable actuation point for the switches
Cable routing options on the bottom
Volume wheel feels nice to use
cons: Subpar keycaps
OLED screen feels a bit gimmicky
Navigation cluster and function keys don’t have OmniPoint switches

name: Ducky Mecha Mini Review
pros: Comes with a lot of extras in the box
cons: Cable could look/feel more premium
Optional software would be nice

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Brown, Cherry MX Black, Cherry MX Blue, Cherry MX Silver, Cherry MX Red, Cherry MX Silent Red

name: Zowie Celeritas II Review
cons: Bulky
Case picks up fingerprints rather easily
Only red lighting (no RGB)

name: Ducky One 2 SF Review
pros: 65% form factor is a perfect marriage between functionality and compactness
cons: Cable is noticeably less premium than the rest of the overall package

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Brown, Cherry MX Black, Cherry MX Blue, Cherry MX Silver, Cherry MX Red, Cherry MX Silent Red

name: Corsair K70 RGB Mk.2 Review
pros: Media keys and volume wheel feel good to use
cons: Plasticky and cheap feeling wrist rest
Thick and non-detachable cable can be bothersome with no routing options on the bottom
ABS keycaps feel subpar

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Red, Cherry MX Brown, Cherry MX Blue, Cherry MX Silent, Cherry MX Speed, Cherry MX Low Profile Red, Cherry MX Low Profile Speed

name: Xtrfy K2-RGB Review
cons: No software to customize lighting
Cable routing channels on the bottom

name: Logitech G Pro Mechanical Keyboard Review
cons: Keycaps can’t be swapped out due to proprietary Romer-G switches

name: Razer Blackwidow Tournament Edition Chroma v2 Review
cons: Subpar keycaps
Stabilizers aren’t very good

specs.Switches: Razer Green, Razer Yellow, Razer Orange

name: Razer Blackwidow Elite Review
cons: Subpar keycaps
Not very portable

specs.Switches: Razer Green, Razer Orange, Razer Yellow

name: Ducky One 2 Mini RGB Review
cons: Plasticky build can feel a bit flimsy at times

specs.Switches: Cherry MX Red, Cherry MX Brown, Cherry MX Blue

name: Glorious GMMK TKL Review
cons: RGB lighting is unimpressive
